# Description: tapply() is a very powerful function that l. by deafault we # simplify the result. # if we would like to get a list the fourth argument would be: simplify = FALSE. # Example below: Given a vector of numbers, one simple operation is to take group means.
# Generating random numbers with different distributions $list$ <- c(rnorm(10), runif(10), rnorm(10, 1)) # defining some groups $groups$<- gl(3, 10) # Applying the mean function on each group res <- tapply($list$, $groups$, $function$)
template.description: breaks a vector into GROUPS and then apply a function to each of the GROUPS
